Key Match Events: Pineda scored the first goal after less than five minutes.
Huerta doubled the lead early in the second half.
Romo scored the third goal shortly after Huerta's second.
New Zealand managed only one effort on target in the 70th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Without key players like Guillermo Ochoa, Edson Álvarez, Raúl Jiménez, or Hirving Lozano, a new group of talent started the new Aguirre era.
The match was a statement for Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge of the Mexico Men’s National Team.
Post-Match Reflections: El Tri dominated the match with 13 shots to two, showcasing their control over the game.
New Zealand struggled defensively, conceding easily despite sparse attendance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge began with a 3-0 win.
Orbelin Pineda and Cesar Huerta were key contributors to the victory.
